product_context.title: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: Was setting up hue lights for client's kitchen, I have like 30+ hue lights at home so I have a bridge. The clients don't really care about the bridge they just wanted good lights so I was trying to pair the lights with the remote only. I got this v2 one because it specifically said it will work. At first try I couldn't get it to work because I was using the app to pair it. On the instruction it actually has the section showing how to pair without bridge and you just pair it by placing the remote close to the lightstrip or bulb and hold the button it will pair and work. Love it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2025
reviews.title: Yes it works without a bridge

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: Was very easy to set up and install. The wall mount has the option to screw it into the wall but I opted to just use the 3M adhesive that comes on the back of the wall mount. I put it on the wall just above the actual light switches. The remote sticks to the mount via magnets. The magnets are the perfect strength, they hold the remote firmly in place but yet it is easy to pop the remote off the wall to keep on a nightstand etc. Setup in the app was easy and you can really customize what you want each button to do. My only complaint is that when I first walk into the room I have to hit the buttons a few times before they work. I’m guessing this is because the remote is in some kind of standby mode when not in use? I’m hooked up to a bridge on 1 gig high speed business internet at the house so I don’t think it’s a connectivity issue on my end. Despite this minor flaw I’m very happy I purchased this remote so I don’t have to fumble around with my phone every time I walk into a room. Will probably get hue bulbs + one of these switches in every room eventually
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
reviews.title: Easy to set up, convenient

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: I wanted to like this dimmer, but after having it a few weeks - I don't, and will be going back to a regular switch. The problem is; you have to look at it and aim for the button at the top - in a dark room... My wife and I keep knocking it off the wall, because we're used to just having a simple switch... I mostly just want to turn on or off the light; rarely do I need to dim it, or change "scenes", and when I do - it can be done in the app. A better design, would be a large ON/OFF toggle with a very small dim slider or knob off to the side. Basically, this design puts features before usability. I won't buy any more until they address this.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2024
reviews.title: Needs usability improvements.

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: I like how easy it is to pair and setup the remote. The app will give some reasonable defaults and ask you a few questions as to which bulbs it controls. Once done, the remote works every time. If you have a smart bulb in a lamp or something, it's essential to have a manual control. If I need to turn a lamp on in the bedroom at night, I don't want to use a voice assistant or fumble with an app. You can configure the press and hold to turn off all lights in the house. I would prefer if this could be configured to turn off all lights in the room.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.title: Essential is you use smart bulbs

reviews.text: My gf had a love/hate relationship with the Philips Hue lights I put in her home. She loved all the scenes she could choose from, but she hated pulling out her phone to turn on lights when she came home. I got her this as a gift and she 100% loves her Hue lights again. You set this up with 5 different scenes, which are accessible by tapping the button once for each scene option.

reviews.title: Perfect for less tech-enthused household members

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: This new Hue dimmer looks awesome and works great. As with anything Hue related, it pairs easy and shows up in the Hue app as well and Apple Homekit. I love the fact that the on/off is now one button and you can change the scene with the bottom one as well as dim or Brighton with the center rocker. Overall great product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviews.title: Big fan.

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: I thought this would be a nice upgrade to my v1 switch, which doesn't work well with Homekit where supposedly this one does... however, this one doesn't even install. I followed the instructions of pressing the Power button for 3 seconds, if that doesn't work open the back and press the Setup for 2 seconds, if that doesn't work press Setup for 10 seconds.... etc. etc. Nothing works. I think the switch might be fine and it's just the completely useless Hue app that is the problem, as I do see the switch's blinking lights turn green.... but ultimately this is a complete waste of time and money. The fact that the app says "Need help? Visit philips-hue.com/support" and the site sends you to some completely pointless random marketing site about how wonderful Philips is, while offering absolutely 0 support, speaks volumes :( Ultimately, this switch is useless trash. I'll look elsewhere, and I'll migrate away from the Philips Hue system if this is what passes as quality product from them now after their strong initial offerings in home automation.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.title: Can't even install it

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: I have a rental that had two rooms with a ceiling fan that had a pull string for lights. We removed the fan and did not want to put in another fan/light. Only problem was the room doesn't have a light switch for the ceiling wiring. This worked out perfectly. I screwed one Phillips Hue bulb, held the power button on the switch a few seconds until the bulb blinked to pair. Then repeated the process for a second hue bulb. Now the room has a on/off switch and the bulbs even dim. I didn't have to download any app or any of that non sense. Very happy that I didn't have to get a electrician to break my walls to run a wire for me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.title: Perfect for my room with no light switches

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: It works well and I recommend it if you are buying for the first time. But if you have Gen 1 version around your house, be warned that they changed the bottom button from Off to Hue. That means I have a mix matched version of these around the house and some I have to hit the bottom button to turn it off and some I have to hit to top button. Doesn't sound like a big deal but it is as I end up dimming lights on the new ones.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.title: They changed the buttons

reviews.productTitle: Philips Hue Smart Wireless Dimmer Switch V2 (Installation-Free, Exclusive Philips Hue Lights) for Indoor Home Lighting, Livingroom, Bedroom
reviews.text: I didn’t realize the switch had changed. I have a house full of the v1 and now they’ve changed. I wouldn't care about the aesthetic changes if I could program it to use the bottom button as an off switch. Who could have thought this was a good idea? Did someone think they would incentivize people to replace all their v1 switches because they were so frustrated by having different types? It incentivizes me not to buy the bulbs or switches for the other rooms I was going to do. As it is, the lights keep getting left on so it’s not helpful. To add insult to injury, I figured I would swap this one with one in a room my wife never uses but they shape is not compatible. So I’d have to try to move it without damaging the wall and get it to re-stick.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2022
reviews.title: So frustrating
